title: How to Write in Another Language on Your Mac Computer

steps.title: Click on the Apple menu and then System Settings.
steps.content: Click on the Apple menu and then System Settings . The Apple menu opens when you click the black apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Keyboard.
steps.content: Click Keyboard . It's in the sidebar menu on the left of the System Settings window. You might have to scroll down to find it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Edit next to "Input Sources."
steps.content: Click Edit next to "Input Sources." You'll see this on the right side of the window under the "Text Input" header with a list of current languages.

steps.title: Click ➕ below the left pane of the dialog box.
steps.content: Click ➕ below the left pane of the dialog box. You'll find the plus sign icon below the left pane where your keyboard's current languages are displayed. Clicking this will allow you to add another language to your keyboard so you can easily switch to it.

steps.title: Click on a language.
steps.content: Click on a language. They're listed alphabetically. Keyboard languages that have already been added are at the top of the list.

steps.title: Click the desired keyboard/input style for the language.
steps.content: Click the desired keyboard/input style for the language. They're displayed in the right pane of the dialog box. An example of the keyboard layout will appear below the right pane when you click on an input source.

steps.title: Click on Add.
steps.content: Click on Add . You'll be able to type in that language now, but you still have to switch your keyboard to that language. Follow the next steps to switch.

steps.title: Toggle on Show Input menu in menu bar.
steps.content: Toggle on Show Input menu in menu bar . Make sure the toggle next to "Show input menu in menu bar" is enabled (showing blue) so you can quickly switch your keyboard language. You'll see this option at the top of the Input Sources menu. When you're finished, click Done at the bottom right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click on the flag or language icon on the right side of the menu bar.
steps.content: Click on the flag or language icon on the right side of the menu bar. Look for a symbol in the menu bar at the top of your Mac's screen. It should look like a flag or a rectangle containing a language symbol (such as US for American English). Click it to open a dropdown menu.

steps.title: Click on the language you want to use with your keyboard.
steps.content: Click on the language you want to use with your keyboard. Follow the same steps whenever you want to change the language again. [3] X Research source Alternatively, press the Globe key to change your input language. If pressing it does nothing or something else, go to System Settings > Keyboard and make sure the Globe key is set to change your input source.
